title: Dedication to Isis and Serapis by Caius Ennius Secundus
support: Small quadrangular base in marble (or the local Taormina breccia?), with a quadrangular depression in the centre with holes at the four corners.

layout.p: Latin text over three lines, intended to be centred on the stone, but the right margin is poorly controlled and the text runs up against the edge.

handNote.lettering: Deeply incised letters (reflecting the need for exaggerated depth for visibility on this stone?) with serifs, and angular or comma-shaped interpuncts.

provenanceFound._: Acquired in 1868 from D. Gaetano Zucchero of Taormina, having been found in the area of the Chiesa di San Pancrazio, together with a statue of a priestess of Isis

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
museum.description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
